result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Not eligible for expungement.

9:07 AM Defendant Anthony J Ortiz in court.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Anthony J Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.   Case is resolved.  Defense has filed a plea quest.  State files an amended information.  Rec'd, Reading waived. Upon plea to Ct. 1 in the amended information the State would recommend i/s RCJ, 2 yr. probation.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  
Plea:
Ct. 1- GUILTY
BTC:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, 6 mo. RCJ, i/s, 2 yr. probation. 

Conditions:
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent. 
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote. 
Not eligible for expungement.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:14 PM
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. 
Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony J Ortiz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn appeared by video for Anthony J Ortiz.
